contentrichtext.text: '''Louis Aleman''' (c. 1390 â€“ September 16, 1450) was a [[France|French]] [[Cardinal (Catholicism)|cardinal]]. ==Biography== Aleman was born of a noble family at the castle of [[Arbent]] near [[Bugey]]. A relative was the [[Papal Chamberlain]].{{sfn|Thurston|1913}} He was successively [[bishop of Maguelonne]] (1418), [[archbishop of Arles]] (1423) and [[Cardinal Priest of S. Cecilia]] (1426).{{sfn|Chisholm|1911}} Aleman was a prominent member of the [[council of Basel]], and, together with Cardinal [[Julian Cesarini]], led the party which maintained the supremacy of general councils over the pope's authority.{{sfn|Chisholm|1911}} In 1440 Aleman obtained the support of the emperor [[Sigismund of Luxemburg|Sigismund]] and of the duke of [[Milan]] to his views, and proclaiming the deposition of [[Pope Eugene IV]], placed the tiara upon the head of [[Amadeus VIII, Duke of Savoy]] (henceforward known as Antipope Felix V).{{sfn|Chisholm|1911}} Eugene retorted by excommunicating the antipope and depriving Aleman of all his ecclesiastical dignities. In order to make an end of the [[Western Schism|schism]], Felix V finally abdicated on Aleman's advice, and [[Pope Nicholas V|Nicholas V]], who had succeeded in 1447, restored the cardinal to all his honours and employed him as legate to [[Germany]] in 1449.{{sfn|Chisholm|1911}} On his return he retired to his diocese of Arles, where he devoted himself zealously to the instruction of his people. He died on September 16, 1450, and was [[beatification|beatified]] by [[Pope Clement VII]] in 1527.{{sfn|Chisholm|1911}} ==Notes== {{Reflist}} ==References== *{{Cite Catholic Encyclopedia |ref=harv |first=Herbert |last=Thurston |wstitle=Blessed Louis Allemand}} ;Attribution * {{1911|wstitle=Aleman, Louis}} ==Further reading== * See U. Chevalier, ''Repert. des sources hist''. (Paris, 1905), p. 130. {{Authority control|VIAF=230011742}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Aleman, Louis | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Catholic cardinal | DATE OF BIRTH = 1390 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 1450 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Aleman, Louis}} [[Category:French cardinals]] [[Category:Archbishops of Arles]] [[Category:15th-century Roman Catholic archbishops]] [[Category:Beatified people]] [[Category:1390 births]] [[Category:1450 deaths]] [[Category:15th-century venerated Christians]]
